property.name: text
property.value: The MapReduce system of Google employs a distributed divide-and-conquer algorithm that this demo aims to simulate. A Split actor divides the work of mapping words in the input file into a number of Map machines. (The input file is ReadTest.map in the same directory as this demo.) Those Map machines output pairs of words and value 1's to the Reduce machines, which then count the occurrences of each word. The outputs from all the Reduce machines are merged and are sent to the Display belonging to this model that generates the MapReduce system.

property.name: text
property.value: Refer to another MapReduce demo created using the Ptalon language, created by Adam Cataldo.

property.name: text
property.value: Run this model and a window will pop up, containing the generated MapReduce system. The number of machines involved in the system is defined by the numberOfMachines parameter. About half of those are Map machines, while the others are Reduce machines. The generated model will be executed immediately, and its merged output will be sent to the Display in this model.

entity.name: ModelName
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: LineReader
entity.doc: Read one line at a time from a text file and output as a string
